detaileddescription.para: Load a set of mappings from a file, filtered by the current SDL_GetPlatform()
Convenience macro.
The list of axes available from a controller

Thumbstick axis values range from SDL_JOYSTICK_AXIS_MIN to SDL_JOYSTICK_AXIS_MAX, and are centered within ~8000 of zero, though advanced UI will allow users to set or autodetect the dead zone, which varies between controllers.
Trigger axis values range from 0 to SDL_JOYSTICK_AXIS_MAX.
The list of buttons available from a controller
Get the SDL joystick layer binding for this controller button/axis mapping
To count the number of game controllers in the system for the following:

Using the SDL_HINT_GAMECONTROLLERCONFIG hint or the SDL_GameControllerAddMapping() you can add support for controllers SDL is unaware of or cause an existing controller to have a different binding. The format is: guid,name,mappings

Where GUID is the string value from SDL_JoystickGetGUIDString(), name is the human readable string for the device and mappings are controller mappings to joystick ones. Under Windows there is a reserved GUID of "xinput" that covers any XInput devices. The mapping format for joystick is: bX - a joystick button, index X hX.Y - hat X with value Y aX - axis X of the joystick Buttons can be used as a controller axis and vice versa.
This string shows an example of a valid mapping for a controller

"03000000341a00003608000000000000,PS3Controller,a:b1,b:b2,y:b3,x:b0,start:b9,guide:b12,back:b8,dpup:h0.1,dpleft:h0.8,dpdown:h0.4,dpright:h0.2,leftshoulder:b4,rightshoulder:b5,leftstick:b10,rightstick:b11,leftx:a0,lefty:a1,rightx:a2,righty:a3,lefttrigger:b6,righttrigger:b7", Load a set of Game Controller mappings from a seekable SDL data stream.
You can call this function several times, if needed, to load different database files.
If a new mapping is loaded for an already known controller GUID, the later version will overwrite the one currently loaded.
Mappings not belonging to the current platform or with no platform field specified will be ignored (i.e. mappings for Linux will be ignored in Windows, etc).
This function will load the text database entirely in memory before processing it, so take this into consideration if you are in a memory constrained environment.

parameterdescription.para: the data stream for the mappings to be added
non-zero to close the stream after being read

simplesect.para: the number of mappings added or -1 on error; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.2.

detaileddescription.para: Add support for controllers that SDL is unaware of or to cause an existing controller to have a different binding.

The mapping string has the format "GUID,name,mapping", where GUID is the string value from SDL_JoystickGetGUIDString(), name is the human readable string for the device and mappings are controller mappings to joystick ones. Under Windows there is a reserved GUID of "xinput" that covers all XInput devices. The mapping format for joystick is: {| |bX |a joystick button, index X |- |hX.Y |hat X with value Y |- |aX |axis X of the joystick |} Buttons can be used as a controller axes and vice versa.
This string shows an example of a valid mapping for a controller:

parameterdescription.para: the mapping string

simplesect.para: 1 if a new mapping is added, 0 if an existing mapping is updated, -1 on error; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

detaileddescription.para: Get the number of mappings installed.

simplesect.para: the number of mappings.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.6.

detaileddescription.para: Get the mapping at a particular index.

simplesect.para: the mapping string. Must be freed with SDL_free(). Returns NULL if the index is out of range.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.6.

detaileddescription.para: Get the game controller mapping string for a given GUID.
The returned string must be freed with SDL_free().

parameterdescription.para: a structure containing the GUID for which a mapping is desired

simplesect.para: a mapping string or NULL on error; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

detaileddescription.para: Get the current mapping of a Game Controller.
The returned string must be freed with SDL_free().
Details about mappings are discussed with SDL_GameControllerAddMapping().

parameterdescription.para: the game controller you want to get the current mapping for

simplesect.para: a string that has the controller's mapping or NULL if no mapping is available; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

detaileddescription.para: Check if the given joystick is supported by the game controller interface.
joystick_index is the same as the device_index passed to SDL_JoystickOpen().

parameterdescription.para: the device_index of a device, up to SDL_NumJoysticks()

simplesect.para: SDL_TRUE if the given joystick is supported by the game controller interface, SDL_FALSE if it isn't or it's an invalid index.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

detaileddescription.para: Get the implementation dependent name for the game controller.
This function can be called before any controllers are opened.
joystick_index is the same as the device_index passed to SDL_JoystickOpen().

parameterdescription.para: the device_index of a device, from zero to SDL_NumJoysticks()-1

simplesect.para: the implementation-dependent name for the game controller, or NULL if there is no name or the index is invalid.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

detaileddescription.para: Get the type of a game controller.
This can be called before any controllers are opened.

parameterdescription.para: the device_index of a device, from zero to SDL_NumJoysticks()-1

simplesect.para: the controller type.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.12.

detaileddescription.para: Get the mapping of a game controller.
This can be called before any controllers are opened.

parameterdescription.para: the device_index of a device, from zero to SDL_NumJoysticks()-1

simplesect.para: the mapping string. Must be freed with SDL_free(). Returns NULL if no mapping is available.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.9.

detaileddescription.para: Open a game controller for use.
joystick_index is the same as the device_index passed to SDL_JoystickOpen().

The index passed as an argument refers to the N'th game controller on the system. This index is not the value which will identify this controller in future controller events. The joystick's instance id (SDL_JoystickID) will be used there instead.

parameterdescription.para: the device_index of a device, up to SDL_NumJoysticks()

simplesect.para: a gamecontroller identifier or NULL if an error occurred; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

detaileddescription.para: Get the SDL_GameController associated with an instance id.

parameterdescription.para: the instance id to get the SDL_GameController for

simplesect.para: an SDL_GameController on success or NULL on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.4.

detaileddescription.para: Get the SDL_GameController associated with a player index.
Please note that the player index is not the device index, nor is it the instance id!

parameterdescription.para: the player index, which is not the device index or the instance id!

simplesect.para: the SDL_GameController associated with a player index.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.12.

detaileddescription.para: Get the implementation-dependent name for an opened game controller.
This is the same name as returned by SDL_GameControllerNameForIndex(), but it takes a controller identifier instead of the (unstable) device index.

parameterdescription.para: a game controller identifier previously returned by SDL_GameControllerOpen()

simplesect.para: the implementation dependent name for the game controller, or NULL if there is no name or the identifier passed is invalid.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

detaileddescription.para: Get the type of this currently opened controller
This is the same name as returned by SDL_GameControllerTypeForIndex(), but it takes a controller identifier instead of the (unstable) device index.

parameterdescription.para: the game controller object to query.

simplesect.para: the controller type.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.12.

detaileddescription.para: Get the player index of an opened game controller.
For XInput controllers this returns the XInput user index.

parameterdescription.para: the game controller object to query.

simplesect.para: the player index for controller, or -1 if it's not available.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.9.

detaileddescription.para: Set the player index of an opened game controller.

parameterdescription.para: the game controller object to adjust.
Player index to assign to this controller.

simplesect.para: This function is available since SDL 2.0.12.

detaileddescription.para: Get the USB vendor ID of an opened controller, if available.
If the vendor ID isn't available this function returns 0.

parameterdescription.para: the game controller object to query.

simplesect.para: the USB vendor ID, or zero if unavailable.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.6.

detaileddescription.para: Get the USB product ID of an opened controller, if available.
If the product ID isn't available this function returns 0.

parameterdescription.para: the game controller object to query.

simplesect.para: the USB product ID, or zero if unavailable.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.6.

detaileddescription.para: Get the product version of an opened controller, if available.
If the product version isn't available this function returns 0.

parameterdescription.para: the game controller object to query.

simplesect.para: the USB product version, or zero if unavailable.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.6.

detaileddescription.para: Get the serial number of an opened controller, if available.
Returns the serial number of the controller, or NULL if it is not available.

parameterdescription.para: the game controller object to query.

simplesect.para: the serial number, or NULL if unavailable.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.14.

detaileddescription.para: Check if a controller has been opened and is currently connected.

parameterdescription.para: a game controller identifier previously returned by SDL_GameControllerOpen()

simplesect.para: SDL_TRUE if the controller has been opened and is currently connected, or SDL_FALSE if not.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

detaileddescription.para: Get the Joystick ID from a Game Controller.

This function will give you a SDL_Joystick object, which allows you to use the SDL_Joystick functions with a SDL_GameController object. This would be useful for getting a joystick's position at any given time, even if it hasn't moved (moving it would produce an event, which would have the axis' value).
The pointer returned is owned by the SDL_GameController. You should not call SDL_JoystickClose() on it, for example, since doing so will likely cause SDL to crash.

parameterdescription.para: the game controller object that you want to get a joystick from

simplesect.para: a SDL_Joystick object; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

detaileddescription.para: Query or change current state of Game Controller events.
If controller events are disabled, you must call SDL_GameControllerUpdate() yourself and check the state of the controller when you want controller information.
Any number can be passed to SDL_GameControllerEventState(), but only -1, 0, and 1 will have any effect. Other numbers will just be returned.

parameterdescription.para: can be one of SDL_QUERY, SDL_IGNORE, or SDL_ENABLE

simplesect.para: the same value passed to the function, with exception to -1 (SDL_QUERY), which will return the current state.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

detaileddescription.para: Manually pump game controller updates if not using the loop.
This function is called automatically by the event loop if events are enabled. Under such circumstances, it will not be necessary to call this function.

simplesect.para: This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

detaileddescription.para: Convert a string into SDL_GameControllerAxis enum.

This function is called internally to translate SDL_GameController mapping strings for the underlying joystick device into the consistent SDL_GameController mapping. You do not normally need to call this function unless you are parsing SDL_GameController mappings in your own code.
Note specially that "righttrigger" and "lefttrigger" map to SDL_CONTROLLER_AXIS_TRIGGERRIGHT and SDL_CONTROLLER_AXIS_TRIGGERLEFT, respectively.

parameterdescription.para: string representing a SDL_GameController axis

simplesect.para: the SDL_GameControllerAxis enum corresponding to the input string, or SDL_CONTROLLER_AXIS_INVALID if no match was found.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

detaileddescription.para: Convert from an SDL_GameControllerAxis enum to a string.
The caller should not SDL_free() the returned string.

parameterdescription.para: an enum value for a given SDL_GameControllerAxis

simplesect.para: a string for the given axis, or NULL if an invalid axis is specified. The string returned is of the format used by SDL_GameController mapping strings.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

detaileddescription.para: Get the SDL joystick layer binding for a controller axis mapping.

parameterdescription.para: a game controller
an axis enum value (one of the SDL_GameControllerAxis values)

simplesect.para: a SDL_GameControllerButtonBind describing the bind. On failure (like the given Controller axis doesn't exist on the device), its .bindType will be SDL_CONTROLLER_BINDTYPE_NONE.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

detaileddescription.para: Query whether a game controller has a given axis.
This merely reports whether the controller's mapping defined this axis, as that is all the information SDL has about the physical device.

parameterdescription.para: a game controller
an axis enum value (an SDL_GameControllerAxis value)

simplesect.para: SDL_TRUE if the controller has this axis, SDL_FALSE otherwise.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.14.

detaileddescription.para: Get the current state of an axis control on a game controller.
The axis indices start at index 0.
The state is a value ranging from -32768 to 32767. Triggers, however, range from 0 to 32767 (they never return a negative value).

parameterdescription.para: a game controller
an axis index (one of the SDL_GameControllerAxis values)

simplesect.para: axis state (including 0) on success or 0 (also) on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

detaileddescription.para: Convert a string into an SDL_GameControllerButton enum.

This function is called internally to translate SDL_GameController mapping strings for the underlying joystick device into the consistent SDL_GameController mapping. You do not normally need to call this function unless you are parsing SDL_GameController mappings in your own code.

parameterdescription.para: string representing a SDL_GameController axis

simplesect.para: the SDL_GameControllerButton enum corresponding to the input string, or SDL_CONTROLLER_AXIS_INVALID if no match was found.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

detaileddescription.para: Convert from an SDL_GameControllerButton enum to a string.
The caller should not SDL_free() the returned string.

parameterdescription.para: an enum value for a given SDL_GameControllerButton

simplesect.para: a string for the given button, or NULL if an invalid axis is specified. The string returned is of the format used by SDL_GameController mapping strings.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

detaileddescription.para: Get the SDL joystick layer binding for a controller button mapping.

parameterdescription.para: a game controller
an button enum value (an SDL_GameControllerButton value)

simplesect.para: a SDL_GameControllerButtonBind describing the bind. On failure (like the given Controller button doesn't exist on the device), its .bindType will be SDL_CONTROLLER_BINDTYPE_NONE.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

detaileddescription.para: Query whether a game controller has a given button.
This merely reports whether the controller's mapping defined this button, as that is all the information SDL has about the physical device.

parameterdescription.para: a game controller
a button enum value (an SDL_GameControllerButton value)

simplesect.para: SDL_TRUE if the controller has this button, SDL_FALSE otherwise.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.14.

detaileddescription.para: Get the current state of a button on a game controller.

parameterdescription.para: a game controller
a button index (one of the SDL_GameControllerButton values)

simplesect.para: 1 for pressed state or 0 for not pressed state or error; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

detaileddescription.para: Get the number of touchpads on a game controller.

simplesect.para: This function is available since SDL 2.0.14.

detaileddescription.para: Get the number of supported simultaneous fingers on a touchpad on a game controller.

simplesect.para: This function is available since SDL 2.0.14.

memberdef.argsstring: (SDL_GameController *gamecontroller, int touchpad, int finger, Uint8 *state, float *x, float *y, float *pressure)
memberdef.name: SDL_GameControllerGetTouchpadFinger

detaileddescription.para: Get the current state of a finger on a touchpad on a game controller.

simplesect.para: This function is available since SDL 2.0.14.

detaileddescription.para: Return whether a game controller has a particular sensor.

parameterdescription.para: The controller to query
The type of sensor to query

simplesect.para: SDL_TRUE if the sensor exists, SDL_FALSE otherwise.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.14.

detaileddescription.para: Set whether data reporting for a game controller sensor is enabled.

parameterdescription.para: The controller to update
The type of sensor to enable/disable
Whether data reporting should be enabled

simplesect.para: 0 or -1 if an error occurred.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.14.

detaileddescription.para: Query whether sensor data reporting is enabled for a game controller.

parameterdescription.para: The controller to query
The type of sensor to query

simplesect.para: SDL_TRUE if the sensor is enabled, SDL_FALSE otherwise.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.14.

detaileddescription.para: Get the data rate (number of events per second) of a game controller sensor.

parameterdescription.para: The controller to query
The type of sensor to query

simplesect.para: the data rate, or 0.0f if the data rate is not available.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.16.

detaileddescription.para: Get the current state of a game controller sensor.
The number of values and interpretation of the data is sensor dependent. See SDL_sensor.h for the details for each type of sensor.

parameterdescription.para: The controller to query
The type of sensor to query
A pointer filled with the current sensor state
The number of values to write to data

simplesect.para: 0 or -1 if an error occurred.
This function is available since SDL 2.0.14.

memberdef.argsstring: (SDL_GameController *gamecontroller, Uint16 low_frequency_rumble, Uint16 high_frequency_rumble, Uint32 duration_ms)
memberdef.name: SDL_GameControllerRumble

detaileddescription.para: Start a rumble effect on a game controller.
Each call to this function cancels any previous rumble effect, and calling it with 0 intensity stops any rumbling.

parameterdescription.para: The controller to vibrate
The intensity of the low frequency (left) rumble motor, from 0 to 0xFFFF
The intensity of the high frequency (right) rumble motor, from 0 to 0xFFFF
The duration of the rumble effect, in milliseconds

simplesect.para: 0, or -1 if rumble isn't supported on this controller
This function is available since SDL 2.0.9.

memberdef.argsstring: (SDL_GameController *gamecontroller, Uint16 left_rumble, Uint16 right_rumble, Uint32 duration_ms)
memberdef.name: SDL_GameControllerRumbleTriggers

detaileddescription.para: Start a rumble effect in the game controller's triggers.
Each call to this function cancels any previous trigger rumble effect, and calling it with 0 intensity stops any rumbling.
Note that this is rumbling of the triggers and not the game controller as a whole. The first controller to offer this feature was the PlayStation 5's DualShock 5.

parameterdescription.para: The controller to vibrate
The intensity of the left trigger rumble motor, from 0 to 0xFFFF
The intensity of the right trigger rumble motor, from 0 to 0xFFFF
The duration of the rumble effect, in milliseconds

simplesect.para: 0, or -1 if trigger rumble isn't supported on this controller
This function is available since SDL 2.0.14.

detaileddescription.para: Query whether a game controller has an LED.

parameterdescription.para: The controller to query

simplesect.para: SDL_TRUE, or SDL_FALSE if this controller does not have a modifiable LED
This function is available since SDL 2.0.14.

detaileddescription.para: Query whether a game controller has rumble support.

parameterdescription.para: The controller to query

simplesect.para: SDL_TRUE, or SDL_FALSE if this controller does not have rumble support
This function is available since SDL 2.0.18.

detaileddescription.para: Query whether a game controller has rumble support on triggers.

parameterdescription.para: The controller to query

simplesect.para: SDL_TRUE, or SDL_FALSE if this controller does not have trigger rumble support
This function is available since SDL 2.0.18.

memberdef.argsstring: (SDL_GameController *gamecontroller, Uint8 red, Uint8 green, Uint8 blue)
memberdef.name: SDL_GameControllerSetLED

detaileddescription.para: Update a game controller's LED color.

parameterdescription.para: The controller to update
The intensity of the red LED
The intensity of the green LED
The intensity of the blue LED

simplesect.para: 0, or -1 if this controller does not have a modifiable LED
This function is available since SDL 2.0.14.

detaileddescription.para: Send a controller specific effect packet

parameterdescription.para: The controller to affect
The data to send to the controller
The size of the data to send to the controller

simplesect.para: 0, or -1 if this controller or driver doesn't support effect packets
This function is available since SDL 2.0.16.

detaileddescription.para: Close a game controller previously opened with SDL_GameControllerOpen().

parameterdescription.para: a game controller identifier previously returned by SDL_GameControllerOpen()

simplesect.para: This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

detaileddescription.para: Return the sfSymbolsName for a given button on a game controller on Apple platforms.

parameterdescription.para: the controller to query
a button on the game controller

simplesect.para: the sfSymbolsName or NULL if the name can't be found
This function is available since SDL 2.0.18.

detaileddescription.para: Return the sfSymbolsName for a given axis on a game controller on Apple platforms.

parameterdescription.para: the controller to query
an axis on the game controller

simplesect.para: the sfSymbolsName or NULL if the name can't be found
This function is available since SDL 2.0.18.

detaileddescription.para: Include file for SDL game controller event handling
In order to use these functions, SDL_Init() must have been called with the SDL_INIT_GAMECONTROLLER flag. This causes SDL to scan the system for game controllers, and load appropriate drivers.
If you would like to receive controller updates while the application is in the background, you should set the following hint before calling SDL_Init(): SDL_HINT_JOYSTICK_ALLOW_BACKGROUND_EVENTS
